# windowDidChangeScreen(_:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the delegate that the window has changed screens.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func windowDidChangeScreen(_ notification: Notification)
```

## Parameters

- **notification**: A notification named [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/didChangeScreenNotification].

## Discussion

You can retrieve the `NSWindow` object in question by sending [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/object] to `notification`.

## Moving Windows

- **windowWillMove(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the window is about to move.
- **windowDidMove(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the window has moved.
- **windowDidChangeScreenProfile(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the window has changed screen display profiles.
- **windowDidChangeBackingProperties(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the window backing properties changed.
